title: Local Anesthetic Dosing Calculator
description: Doses local anesthetics to help avoid toxic doses and prevent Local Anesthetic Systemic Toxicity (LAST)

parameters.name: patient_weight
parameters.description: Patient weight in kg (use ideal body weight for most adults: 60-75 kg depending on height and sex)

parameters.name: concentration_percentage
parameters.description: Concentration of local anesthetic as percentage (e.g., 1.0 for 1% solution = 10 mg/mL)

result.name: maximum_dose
result.description: Maximum safe dose in both mg and mL to prevent LAST

ranges.interpretation: The calculated dose is within safe limits to prevent Local Anesthetic Systemic Toxicity (LAST). Always consider patient-specific factors including age, hepatic function, cardiac status, and injection site.

references: Neal JM, Woodward CM, Harrison TK. The American Society of Regional Anesthesia and Pain Medicine Checklist for Managing Local Anesthetic Systemic Toxicity: 2017 Version. Reg Anesth Pain Med. 2018 Feb;43(2):150-153. doi: 10.1097/AAP.0000000000000726.
El-Boghdadly K, Pawa A, Chin KJ. Local anesthetic systemic toxicity: current perspectives. Local Reg Anesth. 2018 Aug 8;11:35-44. doi: 10.2147/LRA.S154512.
Berde CB, Strichartz GR. Local anesthetics. In: Miller RD, ed. Miller's Anesthesia. 6th ed. Philadelphia, PA: Elsevier Churchill Livingstone; 2005:573-603.
formula: Maximum allowable subcutaneous dose (mg) = Maximum dose per kg × Patient weight (kg). Volume (mL) = Maximum dose (mg) / Concentration (mg/mL), where Concentration (mg/mL) = Percentage × 10.
notes: Maximum doses per drug: Bupivacaine 2 mg/kg, Lidocaine 4.5 mg/kg, Mepivacaine 4.4 mg/kg, Ropivacaine 3 mg/kg
Use ideal body weight for most adults (60-75 kg depending on height and sex)
These doses are for subcutaneous infiltration and nerve blocks
Multiple variables may influence patient's risk of developing LAST including age, cardiac status, hepatic function
Always double-check dosage calculations before administration
Consider lower doses in elderly patients, those with cardiac disease, or hepatic impairment
Signs of LAST include CNS symptoms (seizures, altered mental status) and cardiovascular symptoms (arrhythmias, cardiac arrest)
